body:
I see these warnings when building `gcc`. This output should be hidden.

```
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/libsigsegv/libsigsegv-2.10.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/m4/m4-1.4.17.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/gmp/gmp-6.1.0.tar.bz2
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/isl/isl-0.14.tar.bz2
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/mpfr/mpfr-3.1.4.tar.bz2
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/mpc/mpc-1.0.3.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/bison/bison-3.0.4.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/flex/flex-2.6.0.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/binutils/binutils-2.25.tar.bz2
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /xfs1/eschnetter/spacktest/spack/var/spack/cache/gcc/gcc-6.1.0.tar.bz2
```
title: Don't output warning if package cache is empty
